thread.title: ‘Rose Water & Orange Blossoms’: A warm intro to Lebanese cuisine | Books for Cooks
thread.title_full: ‘Rose Water & Orange Blossoms’: A warm intro to Lebanese cuisine | Books for Cooks | The Seattle Times

author: Rebekah Denn
title: ‘Rose Water & Orange Blossoms’: A warm intro to Lebanese cuisine | Books for Cooks
text:
We recommend: “Rose Water & Orange Blossoms,” by Maureen Abood (Running Press, $30)
What’s special: A warmly written, attractive and personal guide to Lebanese cuisine from a culinary-school graduate who writes a blog of the same name. Abood shares secrets for smooth hummus and spicy lamb kofta, cardamom-scented coffee and sweet walnut pastries, adding educated tweaks to classic family recipes.
Muhammara (Roasted Red Bell Pepper-Walnut Dip) Makes about 2½ cups
2 red bell peppers, trimmed, roasted and peeled (or use jarred roasted red peppers)
Most Read Stories No bodies found in wreckage of Bremerton motel Chelan blazes: With no end in sight, thousands evacuate Reactions mixed to NYT story about Amazon’s work conditions Cascadia fault chatters and pops with little quakes South Snohomish softball team loses Little League World Series tiebreaker game, 3-2 1 cup walnut pieces, toasted
⅔ cup fresh breadcrumbs or panko, toasted
2 teaspoons pomegranate molasses
2 garlic cloves
pinch of red pepper flakes
Juice of ½ lemon
1 teaspoon paprika
½ teaspoon ground cumin (optional)
1 teaspoon kosher salt
Few grinds of black pepper
¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for serving
1. Combine the peppers and walnuts in a food processor and pulse until the mixture is smooth. Add the breadcrumbs, pomegranate molasses, garlic, red pepper flakes, lemon juice, paprika, cumin (if using), salt and pepper, processing to combine.
2. With the processor running, add the olive oil slowly and blend until the oil is completely incorporated.
3. Turn off the processor and scrape down the sides of the processor bowl as you go. Serve the muhammara drizzled with olive oil in a small bowl, chilled or at room temperature.
Rebekah Denn : rebekahdenn@gmail.com ; on Twitter: @rebekahdenn . Rebekah Denn, two-time winner of the James Beard Award, writes about food for several local and national publications.
